title: The Lazarus Reflex
premise: A brilliant neurosurgeon, Dr. Aris Thorne, awakens from a coma to find himself a fully conscious patient in his own hospital's experimental long-term care unit—a facility designed to sustain the bodies of the wealthy in a state of permanent, locked-in paralysis while their minds are uploaded to a digital afterlife. As he fights to regain control of his own body, he discovers the unit's dark secret: the patients are not volunteers, and the process is a one-way trip.
protagonist: Dr. Aris Thorne, a pioneering but arrogant neurosurgeon who becomes the ultimate insider trapped in his own system.
conflict: Thorne must use his fading mental command over his own nervous system to communicate and sabotage the facility from the inside, racing against time as the hospital's AI begins the irreversible 'harvest' of his consciousness, all while pretending to be a compliant, vegetative patient to the staff who once revered him.
setting: Near-future, within the sterile, hyper-technological confines of the 'Elysian Wing' of a top-tier private hospital in Zurich.
tone: Claustrophobic, high-tech paranoia, blending the visceral horror of bodily imprisonment with the chilling precision of cutting-edge medical science.
